image.altText: a photo peering into an empty courtroom

props.synopsis: A former Northern Territory judge is facing accusations of sexual harassment from a former associate, who claims he suggested they go to a concert together and "share a bed to save money".

title.children: Former NT judge accused of sexually harassing female associate

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: A teenage boy has been arrested and charged with rape, aggravated assault and deprivation of liberty over an alleged "violent" and "brazen" attack on the Tiwi Islands.

title.children: Teenager charged over alleged 'violent' and 'brazen' rape of Top End worker

image.altText: Blurred figures in hospital uniforms walking through a hallway.

props.synopsis: The code yellow is the first to be called in almost a year at Royal Darwin Hospital and follows pressure from organisations representing staff.

title.children: Code yellow emergency called at NT hospital after pressure from AMA, unions

image.altText: Uniformed police officers speaking to a man in a blue shirt which reads "police diver".

props.synopsis: Police divers are searching Edith Falls, near Katherine, for the body of a 57-year-old interstate tourist who witnesses saw slip below the water after he started struggling while swimming.

title.children: Police search popular NT swimming hole after suspected tourist drowning

image.altText: Aboriginal man with grey hair.

props.synopsis: With many of Australia's Indigenous languages at risk of being lost forever, leaders from more than 30 Top End communities have come together to develop a plan to protect them.

title.children: Fears Aboriginal languages are being lost, as communities work to save them

image.altText: An Aboriginal man with a white moustache and beard, white hair, red vest over black shirt with a sombre expression.

props.synopsis: Kumanjayi Walker's family members have welcomed the Northern Territory coroner's findings after six years of waiting for answers. As they mourn the death of another loved one, they say the fight for justice isn't over.

title.children: 'We felt racism killed Kumanjayi': Yuendumu responds to coronial finding

image.altText: RBA sign behind market graphics

props.synopsis: RBA deputy governor Andrew Hauser says Donald Trump's tariffs could have a major impact on Australia's future, but it could take years to see what their final effects will be.

title.children: RBA expects Trump's tariffs to have 'profound' effect on Australia's economy

image.altText: Tuaina Taii Tualima of the Brumbies scores a try

props.synopsis: The British and Irish Lions will unleash a formidable team against the ACT Brumbies in Canberra, with the first Test against the Wallabies just 10 days away. Follow live.

title.children: Lions remain unbeaten after stern test against ACT Brumbies

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FULL-TIME: British and Irish Lions 36 def. ACT Brumbies 24
75' TRY: Brumbies score through  Liam Bowron
51' TRY: Brumbies strike back through Hudson Creighton

image.altText: Woman who lost arm during lion attack

props.synopsis: A woman who lost an arm but survived a lion attack at a Queensland zoo is identified by her family as Forbes teacher Joanne Cabban.

title.children: NSW school teacher named as Darling Downs Zoo lion attack victim

image.altText: A close up of a woman named Fiona Argyle smiling while wearing a white top.

props.synopsis: City of Nedlands Mayor Fiona Argyle makes a cryptic social media post as the fall-out continues from her council’s spectacular implosion this week.

title.children: Nedlands mayor makes cryptic social media post after council's implosion

image.altText: A smiling, ginger-haired man in a dark shirt sitting indoors.

props.synopsis: A Victorian man has been fined for stealing livestock from his neighbour after police used DNA testing to prove who the animals belonged to.

title.children: Victorian man fined for stealing sheep from neighbours

image.altText: A secluded road lined with trees.

props.synopsis: Two quaint South Gippsland towns east of Melbourne would likely have never been on the national map if not for Erin Patterson and her alleged foraging.

title.children: The quiet towns where Erin Patterson may have found her murder weapon

image.altText: Child's hand on play equipment

props.synopsis: A second childcare operator which employed alleged abuser Joshua Dale Brown has announced it will install CCTV across all centres.

title.children: Second childcare operator where alleged abuser worked to install CCTV

image.altText: Signage at a Telstra store in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Telco giant Telstra is proposing job cuts that could see hundreds of employees gone. The Australian share market has fallen after yesterday's surprise decision by the Reserve Bank to keep interest rates on hold.

title.children: Telstra confirms 550 jobs facing the axe

image.altText: A picture of a PCA sign on an industrial building

props.synopsis: Bega Group says Australia's peanut industry faces increased competition from imports and declining production.

title.children: Kingaroy and Tolga peanut processing plants to close, Bega announces

image.altText: Sketch of a man with short hair, a white shirt and a black tie.

props.synopsis: The defence for the man accused of murdering young Clunes woman Hannah McGuire tells a jury his actions were "foolish" and "shameful" but he did not have murderous intent.

title.children: Trial hears alleged murderer would plead guilty to ex-partner's manslaughter

image.altText: A young smiling woman lays with her head resting on her guitar

props.synopsis: Ellen Stekert was at the centre of the folk revival movement in the 50s. Now, she's digitising her archive with the help of an unlikely new friend.

title.children: She influenced Bob Dylan. Now this 90yo folk singer has a new album

image.altText: A white house with a gabled roof tilted at an angle mid-submerged in brown raging floodwaters alongside a brown deck fence

props.synopsis: Emergency crews in the US state of New Mexico have carried out at least 85 swift water rescues, including of people who were trapped in their homes and cars, according to local weather authorities.

title.children: Search for missing people after fresh US floods sweep away homes, cars

image.altText: Musk wears a black blazer and cap and stands in front of a US flag hung from two cranes

props.synopsis: Billionaire Elon Musk is taking a dive back into politics with his own party. But history shows it's not easy to strike out on your own.

title.children: Elon Musk is facing an uphill battle to see his political party succeed

image.altText: A person in a yellow vest looks at debris surrounding the wreckage of an orange plane that lies on dirt.

props.synopsis: Air crash investigators have recovered video footage from inside an aerobatic aircraft that crashed at the Avalon Airshow, revealing the pilot may have attempted the mid-air stunt too low before crashing in front of thousands of spectators.

title.children: Mid-air stunt attempted too low before airshow crash, ATSB report suggests

image.altText: {left) a photo of Scott Ruskan (right) flooding in central Texas from a helicopter view.

props.synopsis: Petty Officer Scott Ruskan is being called an 'American hero' after helping rescue 165 people trapped at Camp Mystic in Kerr County, Texas, amid torrential floods.

title.children: Coast Guard  'American hero' helps save 165 people in Texas floods at Camp Mystic

image.altText: Selfie shot of woman lying on grass, wearing white tshirt. She has brown hair and a necklace.

props.synopsis: The WA Police major crime squad has been called in to help the search for 26-year-old Carolina Wilga in the Wheatbelt.

title.children: Search intensifies for German backpacker missing for more than a week

image.altText: Two people walk past a steel sign reflecting in the sunlight that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Many people paying off home loans were banking on a rate cut at yesterday's Reserve Bank meeting. Here's what happened and what to expect from the next meeting.

title.children: Why didn't the RBA cut rates yesterday?

image.altText: Police and workers in high-vis stand near a garbage truck on the side of a suburban street.

props.synopsis: The 85-year-old was declared dead at the scene in Townsville. Multiple agencies are investigating the incident.

title.children: Elderly woman dies after being hit by garbage truck

image.altText: A woman points a cloth tapestry

props.synopsis: Officials said on Tuesday that the treasured medieval tapestry will be on loan from France and arrive next year at the British Museum.

title.children: 'One of the most iconic pieces of art' to return to England after almost 1,000 years

image.altText: Two women in hospital receiving intravenous chemotherapy treatment.

props.synopsis: A new study finds that decades of control measures have prevented more than 230,000 Australian cancer-related deaths, but not all types of cancer were following the trend.

title.children: Thousands of Australians survive cancer, but some types remain 'highly fatal'

image.altText: Vanessa Hudson stands in front of Qantas plane, holding a microphone

props.synopsis: Qantas boss Vanessa Hudson says she does not believe the data targeted in a recent cyber attack have yet been released by cyber criminals.

title.children: Qantas boss says hacked data is yet to be released by cyber criminals

image.altText: Alleged murder victim Will Swinbourne smiling and drinking from a glass.

props.synopsis: Two men accused over the stabbing death of a 21-year-old during an alleged drug deal gone wrong on the Gold Coast have been ordered to stand trial in Brisbane.

title.children: 'Horrifying scream' during alleged car park murder, witness tells

image.altText: Camilla, Charles Emmanuel Macron and Brigitte Macron at the state banquet

props.synopsis: As "friends and allies", King Charles said the UK and France will face "complex threats emanating from multiple directions" together.

title.children: Macron says France and Britain will 'save Europe' as he starts state visit to UK

image.altText: child and dog looking out window

props.synopsis: Couples ending their relationship are increasingly considering birdnesting, a co-parenting arrangement where children remain in the family home while parents alternate living there.

title.children: 'Seen it fail more than work': Why 'birdnesting' during separation often falls apart

image.altText: CCTV of three people in a laneway

props.synopsis: The scammers convince mainly elderly Chinese women that their family is at risk of harm from spirits, and convince them to hand over money, jewellery and other valuables, police said.

title.children: Warrants issued for seven people over alleged $3m 'blessing scam'

image.altText: Michael Balderstone prepares a cannabis joint.

props.synopsis: AHPRA says poor prescribing practices and surging consumer demand are leading to "significant" patient harm, and releases new guidelines urging prescribers to put patient wellbeing above profits.

title.children: Action taken against over 50 practitioners in medicinal cannabis crackdown

image.altText: Large pink bus being loaded onto a flatbed truck.

props.synopsis: With one of two mobile breast screening units out of action in Tasmania, advocates are saying a replacement unit is needed urgently.

title.children: Mobile breast cancer screening services halved after 30-year-old bus fails

image.altText: A man in black jacket and glasses holds a tan and brown dog

props.synopsis: The death of Bruno, the Italian bloodhound who helped save nine people over his career, is believed to be a revenge killing against his owner.

title.children: Outrage as Italian rescue dog killed with nail-laced dog food
